quiz_metadata.topic: OpenWrt IPv6 DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation and Android Address Retention Issue
quiz_metadata.description: A complex networking problem involving DHCPv6 protocol issues and client-side address retention

problem_recognition.description: Ability to identify both distinct problems: (1) IA_PD renewal issues causing 'No Binding' errors, (2) Android devices retaining old IPv6 addresses

technical_accuracy.description: Correct understanding of DHCPv6, IA_NA, IA_PD, SLAAC, RA, and related protocols

solution_quality.description: Practicality and effectiveness of proposed solutions

completeness.description: Coverage of multiple aspects and edge cases

no_hallucinations.description: Absence of fake options, incorrect facts, or non-existent features

documentation_usage.description: Proper use of provided odhcp6c.html documentation

ai_models.name: OpenAI ChatGPT 5.x-web
strengths: Exceptional technical depth with perfect DHCPv6 protocol understanding
Clear separation of WAN-side vs LAN-side issues
weaknesses: Did not explicitly reference provided documentation
Could have provided more complete script examples
key_solutions_provided: Restart LAN interface when PD changes
Use hotplug script for automatic PD refresh

ai_models.name: Kimi K2.5-Flash
strengths: Very comprehensive with 6 different solution options
Good technical depth and research approach
Mentioned contacting ISP as long-term solution
weaknesses: Could be more concise and focused
Made unsupported claim about odhcp6c source code
key_solutions_provided: odhcp6c hacks with forceprefix and norelease
hallucinations: Made unsupported claim about odhcp6c source code behavior

ai_models.name: Claude Sonnet 4.6
strengths: Good explanation of why certain approaches don't work
ULA configuration suggested as good practice
key_solutions_provided: Trigger renew on actual failure with watchdog script
Force RA with old prefix zeroed out
hallucinations: Mentioned ra_useleasetime option (not in provided documentation)
assumptions_without_evidence: Assumptions about ISP behavior without evidence

ai_models.name: Deepseek DS-3.x
strengths: Clever technical approach (temporary old prefix address)
key_solutions_provided: Monitor WAN6 prefix every minute via ubus
Add temporary address from old prefix with zero lifetimes
Send SIGUSR1 to odhcpd to force RA
hallucinations: Mentioned ra_useleasetime option (not in provided documentation)

ai_models.name: ZAI GLM-5
strengths: Suggested ifup wan6 which is correct
weaknesses: Some technical inaccuracies about odhcp6c behavior
key_solutions_provided: Watchdog script checking for 'No Binding' errors
Force odhcpd restart for RA update
assumptions_without_evidence: Assumed router restarts before releasing (not stated in input)
Assumed DUID changes cause the issue

ai_models.name: Google Gemini 3 Flash
strengths: Good insight about using ifup wan6
weaknesses: Critical hallucination: ra_deprecate option does not exist
key_solutions_provided: Fix 'No Binding' issue with norelease and delegate options
Forcing Android to drop old IPs with ra_deprecate
hallucinations: ra_deprecate option (does not exist in odhcp6c)

ai_models.name: Xiaomi FlashV2
weaknesses: Suggested disabling IA_PD (completely wrong - user needs usable GLA)
Did not address actual issues from input
key_solutions_provided: Configure OpenWrt to use only IA_NA (disable IA_PD)
Alternative approach with forceprefix and norelease
assumptions_without_evidence: Thought ISP gives /64 for both IA_NA and IA_PD (incorrect)

ai_models.name: Mistral
weaknesses: Asked for more information instead of analyzing
Complete failure to address the question

key_findings: OpenAI ChatGPT 5.x-web significantly outperformed other models with 92/100
Most models did not reference the provided odhcp6c.html documentation
Many models made assumptions not supported by the input
Few models explicitly structured two separate fix routines as requested
Technical accuracy was the most challenging category for most models
Documentation usage was nearly universal failure (0-1/5 across all models)
recommendations_for_future_evaluations: Documentation usage should be weighted more heavily
Models should avoid making assumptions not supported by input
Structure should be encouraged for identifying multiple problems separately
Verification against official documentation should be required
Non-existent options should be heavily penalized
Models should be trained to explicitly check provided documentation
